Judul: South Africa readies for data deluge: Nation seeks to retain control over its information
Abstrak:
Data scientists in South Africa are preparing to be inundated by a flood
of information that is due to crash over them when the country’s biggest radio
telescope doubles the scale of its operations in March. A terabyte-an-hour data deluge, which
would fill more than three DVDs a minute, will flow from a network of radio dishes called the MeerKAT array. Currently consisting of 32 operational dishes
Fakultas: Fakultas Matematika dan Ilmu Pengetahuan Alam
